In Tanganyika and Zanzibar the emergence and growth of the nationalist movements
In Tanganyika and Zanzibar the emergence and growth of the nationalist movements
Salim was born on 23 January 1942 at Mwembeladu Hospital, in Unguja.
At that time hospital facilities were insufficient in Pemba, his parents’ home,
his mother hailed from Unguja – the other main island that constitutes Zanzibar.
Salim attended standard one to eight in Pemba from 1948 to 1956 at Uweleni Primary School,
as well as at Darajani and Mashimoni primary schools in Unguja.
From 1957 to 1960 Salim attended secondary school in Unguja (standard 9 to 12),
